message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper proposes an approach for unsupervised continual learning, which involves learning representations without any knowledge about task identity. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), natural language processing (cs.CL), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). Among these, machine learning (cs.LG) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on learning representations and incorporates rehearsal-based techniques to deal with catastrophic forgetting. Computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) are also likely categories as the paper uses image datasets (MNIST and Omniglot) to demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed approach.
